summary:
I offer my clients a pragmatic approach in the execution of projects. I inject experience into a project due to the different job rolls I had in the past, ranking from operational to c-level within a multinational. I can help customers with the bigger picture and the cause-effects decisions can bring. I am specialized in PIM, MDM and ETL in conjunction with E Commerce, ERP and Print.

Never force feed a solution to your employees, but make it taste great instead!

Specialties: 
International business, Change management, Internet business, web development, Product Information Management, Master Data Management, system to system integration, web shops, content aggregation.

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

projects.title: Sitecore DAM for Landal
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Landal is one of the main players in leisure bungalow rent. Each year they welcome over 2,8 million guests in more than 100 parks in 9 countries. Landal is expanding rapidly looking at a healthy future with an ambition to welcome more guests in even more parks.

CHALLENGE
The expansion of Landal resonates in the underlaying IT landscape. The rapid growth is demanding more robust systems and stricter processes. One of the pillars of their business is the experience a guest has during the stay. Although centrally stored, it is not easy to find or reuse an asset. Data quality is not yet forced upon the asset, so lots of obsolete assets are still carried around.

SOLUTION
We implemented the Sitecore Digital Asset Management system. Assets are now stored according to a pre-set classification and driven by business rules and workflows. A new asset can therefore no longer be missed. All assets will at least have a minimum amount of data with them and all of them are guarded by a digital rights module.

projects.title: Riversand PIM for Harvest House
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Harvest House is a farmer/grower cooperation, specialized in tomato, paprika, cucumber and artichokes. Growers source their goods to the cooperation who sells it again to the market or to one of their own companies. These independent companies all serve a specialized part of the market. The annual turnover of 835 mil euro places Harvest House in the top of the Dutch market. 

CHALLENGE
All Harvest House companies are selling more or less the same product, but to different markets. These are the same products as sourced by growers. However, all companies do create and use their own product data. Harvest House wants to store all product data centrally.
The next challenge is to bring growers products in line with end user products. From bulk to single.

SOLUTION
We have followed a thorough selection process where the dynamics of the companies, the complexity of the products and the future readiness are evaluated. 
Riversand turned out to be the best fit.

projects.title: inRiver PIM at Wehkamp
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Wehkamp is a large online retailer in the BENELUX selling fashion, electronics, household appliance, etc. They successfully transferred from a catalogue seller to one of the largest online players in 2008. Although their softwarestack is self developed and a bit outdated they are still frontrunners in the market. However to keep pall position, Wehkamp has decided to redevelop it all and only to look at best of breed. They have decided to implement inRiver PIM for product data maintenance.

CHALLENGE
Wehkamp has a rapid changing product portfolio. They are known (and feared) always to be the first company launching new products, way before competitors can or do. They also heavily action and moment driven. If it rains today, there could be a promotion on umbrella's. A quick turn around (hours and minutes, rather than days) is vital. This is demanding for systems, staff and processes.
Our job ticket was to deliver on par with the old system and not build any customization.

SOLUTION
We have untied the existing system and replaced it with a standard inRiver PIM. To do so we had to record all user stories and classify them. If they didn't belong to PIM, they where moved to other functional area's in the infra structure. If they did belong to PIM, stories where refined so they woud fit within standards.
From a very early start the users have been engaged in the process and each two weeks, results have been shared to get instant feedback. We created ambassadors and key users to make a kickstart launch.

RESULTS
Wehkamp has a swift and lightweight PIM solution that maximizes their need for agility. It locks down product data quality by pre-defined processes and serves all outbound channels. It has given a better separation of duties and clear organization of rolls and rights.

contributors.headline: Data Storyteller | Co-Founder of Squadra Group | Partner for Squadra MDM/PIM

CTO/partner at XSARUS & TableTop Order Management

projects.title: Griekse Gids
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
De Griekse Gids is a small keyboard marketing company. They provide lots of information about Greece and sell hotel rooms on the back of it. The Greek guide do offer lots of local information, where to go and what to do. If a customer sports a nice area to stay they will be supported with applicable rooms and flights.

CHALLENGE
The data quality and consistency has proven to be challenging. They (more or less) deliver incomplete bulk information. A user can download it through CSV and/or XML. Every keyboard marketeer needs fresh information to drive revenue, but loading it through Excel is time consuming, let alone enriching it.

SOLUTION
We have implemented a light-weight PIM/ heavy weight ETL. It takes in the files of the touroperators, and converts it to a standardized format. In the next wave it is enriched with missing data and improved location names. In the last wave the database is updated so fresh data will show every hour.

RESULTS
Due to the time consumption, the site was only updated once every 3 days. Each manual update took about 3 hours. Today the site is updated every hour and without any human intervention. It has proven to be a time saver and a money maker.

projects.title: SRC PIM for Levarht
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Levarht are globally selling packaged fruits and vegetables. They purchase from local growers or source fruits in the market. Levarhts strength lays in the customization and rapid packaging. Their turnaround of around 150 million euro makes them one of the largest fruit conveyors in Holland.

CHALLENGE
At first glance products seem to be easy. Selling blue grapes in a clam shell isn’t really that difficult. Until you bring in the customer variable wishes and possible product variations. Levarhts customers can order just blue grapes independent of country and varieties or specified in detail. Levarht needed to store their product data in a re-usable manner and being able to exchange data to GS1.

SOLUTION
SRC is offering a flow driven PIM tool, that can be based on GS1. We created a data model with a parent child relation, where standard product data was stored on parent level. We granulated the data as much as possible, where a sellable end product existed out of the grape, a clam shell and a label.

RESULTS
Levarht created themselves a flexible system. Rather than copying product data over and over again, the basic data was stored only once and re-used afterward. It made them flexible enough to feed their new ERP environment, to handle updates and to feed data-pools.

projects.title: Contentserv PIM for Schoeller Allibert
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Schoeller Allibert is one of main crate producing companies in the world turning over 500mil euro on all sorts of crates. Small once bread crates and shopping crates, to large and complex once like harvesting boxes and crates for process optimization.
Schoeller Allibert is a company that has grown from acquisition with multiple factories in multiple countries. 

CHALLENGE
From a historical point of view, every plant produces its own specialty, selling it to its own customers. There has never been a good overview of all products, let alone the richness of possibilities each product has. It was undoable to find a spare part for a broken product.

SOLUTION
First we modeled the entire chain of crate production. Starting from a mould all the way to the parts, which where combined to products. A final sellable product now exist out of parts (relations) made by moulds (again relations) and available in a given plant. Users now know where to produce and what spare part to order.

RESULTS
Schoeller Allibert moved from a customer specific product to a customizable product per customer. It simplified the ERP introduction because there where less unique products.
Business got involved through process workflows and product data quality is made visible by product oriented dashboards.

projects.title: Informatica PIM for B&S
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
B&S is one of the largest tax free companies selling food and liquor products to difficult locations like war zones, cruise ships and behind customs. They have a profound knowledge of tax legislation and the fine grained network to distribute. If a captains wants to serve a special for his guests, B&S makes it happen. The turn over of 750 mil euro makes B&S one of the largest player in the field.

CHALLENGE
Food comes with legislation, especially in Europe. There is not only a high demand for traceability, but all label information should be available in their systems, serving ordering platforms and websites. When a soup suddenly contains traces of nuts, buyers will need to be informed right away.
Challenges where in the correct initial registration and keeping it up to date during the products life span.

SOLUTION
We used standardization like GS1 to lower the barrier and to simplify data exchange. We build the datamodel on top of the standard and used the GS1 connector to exchange data. Due to the vast amount of products, data brokers where used to onboard raw data taken from product labels and boxes.

RESULTS
A PIM system with workflows to serve internal and external processes. Running on delta exports to Gs1 and  guarding newly born products via a supplier portal. 
B&S has chosen to implement a high data quality standard, where native Informatica data quality tooling has been used.

projects.title: inRiver PIM at Bugaboo
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Bugaboo is a world wide known brand for strollers. Bugaboo strollers are special, not because they look good, feel right and have a hassle less long life span. The beauty of the product lies in the modularity of the product. It can be customized into the smallest details.
Bugaboo runs a global company turning over $120M.

CHALLENGE
Customization comes with complexity especially when not all parts may fit to all strollers. Bugaboo had the need to store all products, components and relations between them in a central repository.
An additional requirement was the design guidelines. Although some spare parts may fit, they look ugly and are therefore not allowed as fit.

SOLUTION
We modeled the the data in a more object oriented PIM system. inRiver turned out to be a perfect fit for it, where all possible spare parts are connected to all possible strollers. In one click it is instantly visible what spare parts and and modules are applicable to what stroller, feeding the websites configurator.

RESULTS
An easy to use and very flexible PIM implementation for the internal user, and a ever green source for the IT landscape.

projects.title: STEP Data Quality in PIM at Office Depot
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Office Depot is one of the largest office suppliers in Europe, serving the Office Depot brand and the Viking brand. They manage all product data through Stibo STEP for both brands and all channels.

CHALLENGE
Although product data has been managed centrally for a while, Office Depot recognized that the quality could be improved. Product data will degrade over time and needs constant maintenance. A proper data quality tooling, all its processes and organization needed to be brought in place.

SOLUTION
First we defined the important aspects of data. What attributes are most important, what processes are leaking and who is toughing the data. Then we defined "quality" in its holistic form, what is it and when is data wrong or right. We drafted the ideal organization with a quality council, members and rolls to lay a proper quality management foundation and will stop the quality from leaking away in future. Last but not least we implemented the STEP DQ tool to measure, report and initiate quality improvement.

RESULTS
Quality is been looked after on a daily basis. Anomalies can be detected straight away and will be corrected through workflows and tasks. Dashboards will give the user a view on the quality status and the outstanding work. A quality councils is looking over any change or addition. Quality is now well organized and managed.

contributors.headline: Data Storyteller | Co-Founder of Squadra Group | Partner for Squadra MDM/PIM

projects.title: Media Cockpit PIM at Facilitylinq
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Facilitylinq is one of Holland largest suppliers of office furniture. 
 
CHALLENGE
Facilitylinq offers almost every available brand. Their product controllability is therefore challenging and the need for a Product Information Management system invertible. Furniture however comes lots and lost of variations. One table can easily be delivered in 150 different variations, making it hard to store in a PIM. The PIM also needed to be integrated with Magento in a fully automated and seamless manner.
 
SOUTION 
We haven implemented the best of breed solution in their market segment that was well affordable and multi configurable. The Media Cockpit of the DAM group offered a configurable PIM and a DAM all together, without any customization. 
Through TALEND open source ETL layer, all new and changed data is transferred to the Magento web shop via a business connector.

RESULTS
Because Facilitylinq now stores all their data in PIM they don't need to plow through pdf's and catalogues whilst putting an offer together. Their product data is stored centrally on a "store once use many" principle. It is kept ever green and fired off to CRM, ERP and web, delivering productivity saving, and data accuracy.

projects.title: Informatica PIM at Bouwmaat
projects.description:
CUSTOMER
Bouwmaat is one of Holland larger construction market selling Business to Business. They sell wood, plaster, nails, equipment, plumbing, etc.

CHALLENGE
Bouwmaat rolled out a multi channel strategy including a new technology stack on e-commerce. Until than product data was stored on local hard drives and maintained in Excel sheets. There was a need to master and control data in a more structured and managed way.

SOLUTION
Bouwmaat selected Heiler (Informatica) PIM to master product data and all its processes. We have implemented the PIM and DAM solution to cover all their workflows. On-boarding data is auto validated and flagged in case it is new/changed so daily maintenance can take place. Heiler also feeds Intershop and a tool for printed publications.

RESULTS
PIM has been wrapped around all internal processes, for minimal disruption. By applying business processes, workflows and quality checks, the quality of product data has successfully been increased. Al channels now share the same content, resulting in higher quality and less effort.

contributors.headline: E-commerce manager at HOME MADE BY_

profile_positions.description: Squadra MDM is focussing on Data Management challenges in the context of Digital Transformation or an eCommerce or omnichannel strategy. Squadra has over 7 years of experience with Product Information Management (PIM) and Master Data Management (MDM), supporting many national and international customers.
profile_positions.title: Product Information Management Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Spark-IT helps companies to train their digital sales. Maximize the sharing of product information with the minimum effort possible.

Online is a challenge for most of our clients. They either face an online growth challenge or an online disruption.
Examples are: 
-	To many channels for my Excel to handle all product data and its variations
-	The quality of product data in my web shop is poor and not driving enough revenue.
-	Product data needs to be exchanged amongst all systems. It needs to be evergreen also in ERP.
-	My company wants to expand in new countries. How do I manage my product data in the best possible way.
-	All other product related data challenges.

Sprak-it will find the best possible solution for your company, with respect to people and systems and come with a plan that works.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Qhuba is an assembly of highly skilled professionals. They all worked at C-Level positions in a company and decided to join forces at Qhuba, sharing their knowledge and experience with others. Qhuba is mostly asked to work on an interim basis, to change or implement a program and to help the client making the right choices.

Qhuba is an execution network, we make it happen.
profile_positions.title: Associate

profile_positions.company: Salmon Netherlands, A Wunderman Commerce Company
profile_positions.description:
For a year I worked as freelance for Eperium to setup their PIM channel and to help them grow their PIM and MDM expertise. 

Eperium works for larger to midsize companies, for whom  Product Information Management (PIM) and Master Data Management (MDM) are trending topics. How to manage a large amount of (product) data, how to onboard data from suppliers, how to enrich it and how to feed your it-landscape with quality data.

Without jumping to conclusions and shifting the box, Eperium first analyze your business, all its products, people and processes. Based on a variety of inputs they advise you what system suits best.
profile_positions.title: PIM MDM Specialist

profile_positions.description:
In a centrally driven European organization, I managed the e-services team of 8 heads located across Europe. The team is responsible for all Internet marketing, websites and system to system integrations.

From early 2000 the channel has been extremely successful since then Xerox grew from 2 % electronic order intake to 50% of all supplies orders, representing a $ 200 million. All has been done through web shops and system to system integrations.

The content management team provides the content for the websites and creates all the catalogues and brochures in all possible county – language combinations.

E-marketing provides the necessary traffic to the sites, to continue the growth. It is looking after email and add word campaigns. 
Besides the operational management of the team I was responsible for the installation and implementation of the European Internet strategy. I was also part of a global strategy team, in order to get better synergy between the U.S. and Europe.

In this role I report directly to the European First line.
profile_positions.title: e-business Manager Europe

profile_positions.description:
From January to September I have written a shell around Sap, to present customer quotations in a graphical format. It reduced production time at sales level, was workflow driven and reduced errors to a minimum. 

From 1998 to 2001 I have worked as graphical specialist. An advisory and sales roll in a strongly business to business oriented market. Because the graphic art market is all about end results, the customer was always approached as partner rather then a customer. Together you find the perfect balance between cost and quality.

In 1997 I have started my first sales job at Xerox as sales man paper. This job included regular tasks like widening and deepening the customer’s needs.
profile_positions.title: Sales rep Graphic art Industry

profile_positions.description:
I have seen my first sales experience as a project. Since University doesn’t provide you with proper human skills, I decided to pick this up in the field.

Van Swaay is a branch of the Imtech Group and a technical trade venture. Van Swaay is selling and installing automatic doors for all sorts of building. As an account manager I was responsible for sales and after sales in a territory. Knowledge of sales and engineering and technique were required.
profile_positions.title: Account manager

profile_positions.description: I built a computer display for blind people.
profile_positions.title: Stagiaire

volunteer_experiences.description: Where there’s a need, there’s a Lion. Lions Clubs International is the largest service club organization in the world. Our 1.4 million members perform valuable service in 210 countries and geographic areas around the globe. Lions are friends, family and neighbors who share a core belief: community is what we make it. We support the small needs in our local environment through fundraising and helping hands.

Living in a small village comes with lots of benefits, but some back draws. It is not always easy to be part of a larger town, where decisions are made from a far distance. Libel are the local eyes and ears of the city council, so voices are heard.

We organize the erection of a large christmas tree in our town square and the welcoming of our Dutch version of father christmas who arrives a little earlier. We run a theater and support local sport clubs with investments towards the city council.
